radiographic_examinations.findings: Small amount of pericardial thickening or fluid, minimal atelectasis at the base of the left lung, unremarkable right kidney, 2 mm calcification in left kidney consistent with calculus, diverticula in sigmoid colon (not inflamed), low-attenuation lesions in liver unchanged from study performed 18 months earlier, several subcentimeter lymph nodes in paraaortic region and right external iliac chain; several prominent inguinal nodes noted bilaterally.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Unchanged relative to a study performed 18 months earlier.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Stable thickening of the apical pleura bilaterally; the lungs, heart, mediastinum, and bony thorax were normal.

Patchy, intense, mononuclear infiltrate associated with edema and tubular injury; eosinophils were conspicuous, neutrophils scant; tubular injury typical of acute tubular injury; normal glomeruli on examination; diagnosis of acute interstitial nephritis with granulomatous reaction compatible with a drug reaction and minimal-change disease.
